comment.author: 59834330@N07
comment._content: She looks like his mother, doesn't she ?

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: Who was he and who was she - mother, aunt? And where was this photo taken? There are many photographs in the State Library of Queensland's collection that have unidentified people, places and times. Can you help to solve some of the mysteries? We invite you to add comments to this photograph if you know who might be in the photograph or where it is.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Lindsay Hardgrave was the son of Ernest Hardgrave, who lived on a selection in the Upper Logan district near Mt Barney and Mt Lindesay in the late 19th and earlier 20th century. Mt Ernest (near Mt Barney) was named after Ernest Hardgrave. I suspect the Rathdowney local history people might have a good deal of info on the family. Descendants still live down that way. My bet is that's his mother. From what I gather, Lindsay Hardgrave was evidently named after Mt Lindesay (which for many years was spelled 'Lindsay')...In the 1920s and 1930s climbers and hikers from Brisbane would often stay at the Hardgrave's farm during trips to Mt Barney and Mt Lindesay. This Brisbane Courier item on the 1932 National Parks Association camp at Mt Barney Mt Ernest provides some background nla.gov.au/nla.news-article22029139 ; There's a pic of Lindsay Hardgrave in Bert Salmon's collection taken during an ascent of Mt Lindesay which Bert and Lindsay made shortly before the 1932 National Parks Association camp...I'll post it on my photostream in the next day or so and add the link.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] That would be great, thanks. It does appear from all of that information that is is most likely his mother. We'll add your information to our record in the catalogue. Thanks so much!
